intro: Dracophyllum densum, commonly known as the dense dracaena, is a shrub native to the island of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces tiny, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, which are followed by small, red berries. Dracophyllum densum is adapted to grow in rocky or well-drained soils, often in coastal or alpine environments.
